intro: Crepis grosii, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It features narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers with ray florets. Crepis grosii is often found in disturbed areas and can be an indicator of poor soil conditions.
